description:
Dude, Where's My Database?

Presented by Eric Florenzano (Django)

There are so many great open source databases out on the market right
now-- we're really in the golden age of databases. Fortunately, Python
can talk to virtually all of them. With so many databases at our
disposal, how do we choose which one to use for our particular use case?

This talk will go over the many different classes of databases,
introduce some of the particular implementations for each class of
database, and describe the strengths and weaknesses of each. By weighing
the pros and cons of each type of database, the speaker hopes to dispel
the many rumors and misconceptions that people have about what's out
there today.

[VIDEO HAS ISSUES: Audio cuts out at about 20 seconds in, then gets out
of sync until around 3:10.]
title: Dude, Where's My Database? (#133)
